article.title: Developer's Guide for MulTEx - The Multi Tier Exception Handling Framework
article.para: In this developer's guide we describe, with which tools and how the software is maintained.

section.title: Programming Tools
section.para: The build process is managed by Maven 2.

section.title: Documentation Tools
section.para: The two textual documents (technical paper Konzepte.pdf, and slides Vortragsfolien.pdf) are still in german language, and edited in OpenOffice.
They must be transformed to PDF manually, and then stored manually to the directory src\site\resources

The User's and the Developer's Guide are already edited as DocBook XML files in the directory src\docbook. See http://www.docbook.org/. This format is especially useful for being managed by a versioning system, and for generating output for different targets, for example web sites, and printed books.

You can edit it in an XML-aware text editor, as in the open source jEdit with it's XML plugin, or with a dedicated DocBook XML editor, as the XMLmind XML Editor, see http://www.xmlmind.com/xmleditor/. The latter is much more comfortable. It is free for non-commercial use.

The DocBook documents are transformed to HTML and PDF by the docbook-maven-plugin for Maven 2, which is located at http://mojo.codehaus.org/docbook-maven-plugin/. The released alpha version 1.0.0 did not work, so we had to use the snapshot from http://snapshots.repository.codehaus.org/.
The command for generating the HTML and PDF output is:
mvn org.codehaus.mojo:docbook-maven-plugin:transformThe documents are generated into the target\site\docbook directory. From file src\site\site.xml you can link to them.
